Navigate to other release versions of Doxee Workplace 2

[6.6](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/workplace-6-6)

[6.7](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/workplace-6-7)

The **File Upload Human Task** allows uploading one or more files of configurable file type and size as a step within a Business Case.

## Configuration
The configuration of a Human Task is done in Process Designer. It consists of three mappings:

- **General parameters:** General properties of the Human Task

- **Input parameters:** Defines the input data which will be consumed by Process Engine

- **Output parameters:** Defines the output data which will be exposed to the user and/or the system

The individual fields for each parameter group are described in detail below.

### General task parameters
All Human Task types require general task parameters. These general parameters are described in [Workplace 2 Human Tasks](https://docs.doxee.com/doxee-platform/docs/workplace-2-6-6-human-tasks-1).

![](data:image/png;base64,)Configuration window for general task parameters in Process Designer

### Input parameters
In addition to the [basic input parameters](https://docs.doxee.com/doxee-platform/docs/workplace-2-6-6-human-tasks-1#basic-input-parameters) common to all Human Task types, the File Upload Human Task also requires the following type-specific input parameters:

Field

Type

Mandatory or optional

Values

Description

`titleMessage`

text/plain

Optional

0..1

Optional header text that will be displayed in Workplace.

### Output parameters
In addition to the [basic output parameters](https://docs.doxee.com/doxee-platform/docs/workplace-2-6-6-human-tasks-1#basic-output-parameters) common to all Human Task types, the Email Human Task also requires the following type-specific output parameters:

Field

Type

Value

Description

`files`

text/xml

Exactly 1

XML containing the Base64-encoded file content and metadata.

Process Designer is a GUI tool for creating and testing Infinica Process Definitions (IPD). It&#39;s a support tool for Process Engine, providing a graphical editing and log interface and removing the necessity to manually write XML processes in a text editor.
